intro: Spigelia chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant produces clusters of orange-red, spurred flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Spigelia chiapensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
